alert.note: Alert for Central Laramie County; South Laramie Range Foothills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 24 at 5:56PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Laramie County through 630 PM MDT... At 556 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm producing a landspout over Warren Af Base, or near Cheyenne, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts, winds in excess of 40 mph, and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Cheyenne, South Greeley, Ranchettes, Warren AFB, Frontier Park, North Cheyenne, Warren Af Base, Fox Farm-College and South Greeley High. This includes the following highways... Interstate 25 in Wyoming between mile markers 6 and 21. Interstate 80 in Wyoming between mile markers 355 and 363. LANDSPOUT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Central Laramie County; South Laramie Range Foothills
